DataElement.preferredName: Adult Health Quality Index Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age._The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease._Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone._Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.

Property.preferredDefinition: The state of the organism when it functions optimally without evidence of disease.:Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone.:Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number.

Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.
An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.
A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
